===Glyph origin===
{{Han etym}}
{{Han compound|糸|木|ls=ic|t1=string|t2=wood}} – strings on a piece of wood, i.e. a wooden musical instrument.

The oracle bone form shows two strings connected to the wood. In the bronze inscriptions, a {{zh-l|*白}} component was added in between the two strings, which may either represent the thumb (fiddling) or a phonetic part.

===Etymology===
The etymological relationship between “music” and “joy” has been discussed in {{zh-ref|Wulff (1935)}} and {{zh-ref|Unger (1983)}}. Unger draws comparison with the following semantic parallelism in Tibetan: {{m|bo|རོལ་མོ||music}} and {{m|bo|རོལ||to enjoy; to amuse oneself; to play}}.
